intro: Nolana carrera, commonly known as the Chilean starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of Chile. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive blue-green color, while the flowers range from white to purple. Nolana carrera is often found in high-altitude areas, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
